6tmy.text: Standard button with CSS modifications and deal to position

qgc4.text: Standard button with CSS modifications and flip

djsg.text: Unicode deal button (using CSS to remove border and background)

mh1x.text: Another Unicode button that shows enlarged view; label does not enlarge

2rqf.text: This is a counter with the buttons customized and moved and linked to label and dealing

snq7.text: Another Unicode button showing default button border

iouh.text: Invisible button on top of background image

4z8b.text: The same Unicode button changing height and width and CSS border radius so it will not overlap other widgets

n8gf.text: If you use color variables, you should also change the on-hover variables to match your color scheme or the default on-hover colors will be used

v7s4.text: Alternatively, use standard css properties, but in that case, there will not be any on-hover funcationality.

9pws.css: color: white; background: black; border-color:white; font-size: 30px

ma9w.text: To change colors, you can use either the CSS property with predefined replacement words  or properties of the button itself. You do not need to and should not use both at the same time. The example buttons in the room do use both at the same time for purposes of demonstration only.

k8ox.css: --wcFontOH: red;--wcFont: #00308F; font-size: 120px; border-style: none; border-radius: 0px; background-color: transparent;

cwmt.text: Another Unicode button removing all borders and background.
